fields.description: In CONF-7378 an issue is tracked down in Seraph that breaks the remember me cookie.  Can you please integrate the latest seraph into JIRA as well?
fields.summary: Remember me cookie issue with Glassfish; integrate latest Seraph into JIRA
Microsoft Excel 2007 displays an extra warning before opening JIRA excel views

fields.description:
When you add a normal comment to an issue, the only buttons shown are "Add" and "Cancel". It would be extremely useful if workflow actions could be performed at the same time by adding buttons for one or more relevant workflow states, eg:

"Hand to Support"   "Add Comment"   "Cancel"

On our JIRA instance we have states such as "Hand to customer" and "Hand to Adaptavist" - if the applicable button could appear under the normal comments box, that would make sure that far more people move the workflow to the correct state when posting comments. Note, however, that not all workflow states should display a button so there would need to be something in the workflow editor that allows us to choose which states have a button under the normal comments box.

As well as getting more people (especially end-users) to use workflow progressions, this would also reduce the number of email notifications (ie. people add a comment, then change the workflow = 2 emails, vs. just adding a comment and clicking the relevant button = 1 email).
fields.summary: Allow workflow changes to be performed when adding normal comments

fields.description: A common function I perform regularly is to compare multiple project's schemes and other settings to ensure I use the same scheme, project lead, category, etc. for a group of projects.  The scheme comparison tool goes a long way in comparing some schemes.  An extremely useful function on many commercial web sites is the ability to compare multiple items after clicking on a checkbox for each of those items (such as comparing ipod or digital camera models on www.cnet.com).  Currently, I need to click on either the list of projects or project categories, click on the project, review the settings I am looking for, click on the project or project category link, click on another project, review its settings, etc.  A side-by-side matrix of multiple projects' settings would greatly ease the administrator's burden and facilitate the desired consistency between those projects.
fields.summary: Project Comparison Utility - Project Diff utility

fields.description: Navigating from one project's details screen to another's is quite cumbersome, especially when checking multiple projects for a particular setting or scheme.  It would be great to either click on a button for NEXT PROJECT or PREVIOUS PROJECT in the category, or even have a pull-down list containing the category & project hierarchy so one could navigate directly to another project's details screen.
fields.summary: Navigation from one project's details screen to another's

fields.description: We've done User Picker and Issue picker...  Group picker is already nominated and I will add Component Picker now.  These four are the main ones that will help a great deal.  Components especially since we at least are going to have a large number of them and simple the multiselect box is cumbersome.
fields.summary: Ajax Component Picker

fields.description:
Currently, some users are entering the due date invalidly as "01/Aug/7", this will be stored as "01/Aug/0007" in the database. 

The same string entered in a custom field date will result in an error: "Date too early. Dates must be after 1970".

We should prevent users entering invalid dates like this by reusing the custom field date validation code's checks in our built-in date fields (eg. due date, version release dates, worklog dates).
fields.summary: Due date not restricted to sensible year range

fields.description:
When:
 -  a custom field is restricted to a particular project
 - The custom field is added as a column to your issue navigator
 - You search across "All projects"

The custom field column does not display.

If you then manually highlight all projects in the list, the column does display.

This is inconsistent. Surely selecting "All projects" should behave the same as manually selecting all projects?

In both cases, the behaviour should be to show the custom field columns.
fields.summary: Project-specific custom field columns don't show when "All projects" selected

fields.description: When fields such as Resolution are replaced with a custom field, this can cause reporting confusion (such as "Resolved" issues appearing in the Open Issues filter).
fields.summary: Add a warning when users create a custom field with the same name as a system field.
Make JIRA respect the minVersion in atlassian-plugin.xml

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13388].
  {panel}

It would be nice to have the ability to enter a free text associated to each screen. It would be more usefull for transition screen to explain what the transition means and remind the user on how to correctly execute the transition.
I try to write a correct doc but users tend never to read docs, it is easier to have them reminded of what they should do directly on the screen..

Thanks
François
fields.summary: Being able to add free text in a screen

fields.description: We need to upgrade atlassian-extras to add new license types for the upcoming VSS plugin.
fields.summary: Upgrade atlassian-extras for the VSS plugin

fields.description:
At the moment, we hide most of the time tracking functionality if the Time Tracking field is hidden in the Field Configuration.  Though we still display the {{Log Work}} operation and the {{Work Log}} tab.
We should not display these.
Will make for a cleaner interface.
fields.summary: Hide Log Work operation and Work Log tab if Time Tracking Field is hidden in Field Config

fields.description: Various stylesheets and javascript files don't get reloaded by a users browser after an upgrade of JIRA.  This may result in old styles being displayed until a user hits refresh (F5) on a certain page.

fields.description:
Please assist new JIRA users by creating implementation guidelines for server hardware so that users can estimate the specifications for their planned environment. This could be linked from http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.6.5/requirements.html and incorporate information from that page.

 If no guidelines exist, please document this fact. A similar example for Confluence is at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Server+Hardware+Requirements+Guide
fields.summary: Document server hardware requirements guide containing sizing estimates for high-load environments

fields.description:
Hi,

We have been using JIRA for many years now, and are generally a happy client.  I should have filed this issue years ago, but recently this was brought to my attention again.

We use attachments extensively, and we even introduced guidelines for the naming of attachments so they're ordered the way we want to.  But this proves unworkable in the long run.  Therefore, the enhancement request is to make it possible to order attachment in various ways, such as name, creation date, modification date, etc.  This sorting should stay in effect across issues (i.e. it is not issue specific).

Thanks,

\-Jaap\-
fields.summary: Order of attachments

fields.description:
I'm using the JIRA-generated XML export for each issue to transform it into RDF --Baetle, for that matter. 

In order to uniquely identify each comment on an issue, I need to reconstruct the comment permalink using the existing InfoSet but the comment element doesn't seem to have an 'id' attribute unlike the attachment element.

Example: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FOR-1000#action_12500994
The 8-digit number identifying a comment doesn't seem to be available in the generated XML [1].
[1] https://issues.apache.org/jira/si/jira.issueviews:issue-xml/FOR-1000/FOR-1000.xml

Would it be possible to add an 'id' attribute to the 'comment' element?
fields.summary: Absence of an identifier on the comment element in per-issue generated XML

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13362].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are no immediate plans to put this suggestion on our near term roadmap.

I'd recommend to take a look at [Portfolio for JIRA|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/portfolio]'s features to evaluate if that could help you manage and schedule your issues as described here.

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Daniel Franz
dfranz@atlassian.com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
  

The following (if feasible) would allow issue dependencies to be created, ranging from just two issues up to potentially all issues in a given version of a project.

This would allow Gantt charts to be created.

********************************

Add two fields to JIRA issues: 
- ScheduleType (single-select list) -- required.
- StartDate (time/date) -- requiredness depends on the value of ScheduleType as itemised below.

Add one field to JIRA project versions:
- VersionStartDate (time/date) -- required.

Make the following existing field required:
- VersionDueDate (time/date) -- required.


Enhance the global configuration of Link Types so that one Link Type must be nominated as the 'Master' (this Link Type will be used to control actual dependencies between issues).

********************************

ScheduleType has 7 possible values: 

1. 'Issue Start Date'
2. 'Issue Due Date'
3. 'Start After Linked Issues Finish'
4. 'Finish Before Linked Issues Start'
5. 'Version Start Date'
6. 'Version Due Date'
7. 'None'

Depending on which value the user selects, the following will occur: 

(1). If ScheduleType = 'Issue Start Date', then:
- OriginalEstimate is required.
- StartDate is required.
- DueDate (non-editable) is automatically set to StartDate plus OriginalEstimate (or, if work has already commenced, to StartDate plus RemainingEstimate).

(2). If ScheduleType = 'Issue Due Date', then:
- OriginalEstimate is required.
- StartDate (non-editable) is automatically set to DueDate minus OriginalEstimate.
- DueDate is required.

(3). If ScheduleType = 'Version Start Date', then:
- OriginalEstimate is required.
- StartDate (non-editable) is automatically set to the VersionStartDate.
- DueDate (non-editable) is automatically set to StartDate plus OriginalEstimate (or, if work has already commenced, to StartDate plus RemainingEstimate).

(4). If ScheduleType = 'Version Finish Date', then:
- OriginalEstimate is required.
- DueDate (non-editable) is automatically set to the VersionDueDate.
- StartDate (non-editable) is automatically set to DueDate minus OriginalEstimate.

(5). If ScheduleType = 'Start After Linked Issues Finish', then:
- OriginalEstimate is required.
- StartDate (non-editable) is automatically set to the latest DueDate of all linked issues where the Link Type matches the specified 'Master' Link Type and the current issue contains the Outgoing Link; or if no such links exist, to the VersionStartDate.
- DueDate (non-editable) is automatically set to StartDate plus OriginalEstimate (or, if work has already commenced, to StartDate plus RemainingEstimate).

(6). If ScheduleType = 'Finish Before Linked Issues Start', then:
- OriginalEstimate is required.
- DueDate (non-editable) is automatically set to the earliest StartDate of all linked issues where the Link Type matches the specified 'Master' Link Type and the current issue contains the Incoming Link; or if no such links exist, to the VersionDueDate.
- StartDate (non-editable) is automatically set to DueDate minus OriginalEstimate.


(7). If ScheduleType = 'None', then:
- StartDate is editable (and optional); but cannot be set to empty if any Outgoing links of the 'Master' Link Type exist.
- DueDate is editable (and optional); but cannot be set to empty if any Incoming links of the 'Master' Link Type exist.

********************************

NOTES: 
(i). The system 'Time Tracking' values (i.e. 'Hours per day' and 'Days per week') would need to be taken into account in the above calculations. 
(ii). Whenever there is a change to an issue's StartDate, DueDate, OriginalEstimate or RemainingEstimate, any linked issues (where the 'Master' Link Type is used) would need to be updated as per (5) and (6) above.
(iii). Whenever a link between two issues is created, using the 'Master' Link Type, it would need to be validated to ensure that no circular dependencies are created; and any dependent issues would need to be updated as per (5) and (6) above.
(iv). Whenever a link between two issues, of the 'Master' Link Type, is deleted, any linked issues would need to be updated as per (5) and (6) above.
(v). Whenever there is a change to a version's VersionStartDate or VersionDueDate, any dependent issues would need to be updated as per (3), (4), (5) and (6) above.
(vi). StartDate should not be used to constrain the 'Start Date' that appears on the 'Log Work' popup -- this would just get too messy.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA issues to be scheduled based on either Issue Due Date, Issue Start Date, Version Due Date, Version Start Date, Linked Due Date or Linked Start Date
Allow to select default assignee on the create and edit component screens for enterprise edition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13360].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

According to ---JRA-188---, voting on resolved issues was taken out. However, this is a really useful feature in our installation for at least two reasons:

1. We use voting as a peer review mechanism, and highlight high vote issues come review time. This creates a bad incentive to leave votes open longer than they should
2. In our public JIRA install, we'd like to still collect votes on issues we marked "resolve/wont fix", so that we can reconsider should there be a popular groundswell.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow Admin to set a default setting so that there will be a global setting whether the Admin wants users to vote on a Resolved issues or not.
fields.summary: SHOULD be able to vote for resolved issues

fields.description:
The RSS feed Jira provides does not encode the XML-file correctly when Swedish characters are used in data. 

It keeps character in non UTF-8 encoding, but does not change the encoding attribute of the XML-element. 

<!-- RSS generated by JIRA (Enterprise Edition, Version: 3.8-#209) at Fri Aug 17 14:10:45 CEST 2007 --> 
<!-- If you wish to do custom client-side styling of RSS, uncomment this: 
<?xml-stylesheet href="http://jira.mogul.se/styles/jirarss2html.xsl" type="text/xsl"?> 
--> 
<rss version="2.0" > 
<channel> 
    <title>Mogul JIRA</title> 
    <link>http://jira.mogul.se/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&resolution=-1&assigneeSelect=issue_current_user&sorter/field=updated&sorter/order=DESC</link> 
... 
    <author>Ola Schön</author> 
... 

1. Either the Jira Rss feed should have a xml header specifying the content encoding it uses, eg 
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="iso889-1"?> 

2. Or it must make sure all data is encoded as utf8. 

Here are som XML parser output examples: 

12:14:01,489 ERROR [WebCachePool:68] http://USE_PRINCIPAL@jira.mogul.se/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-rss/temp/SearchRequest.xml?&resolution=-1&assigneeSelect=issue_current_user&sorter/field=updated&sorter/order=DESC&tempMax=15&os_authType=basic com.sun.syndication.io.ParsingFeedException: Invalid XML: Error on line 672: Invalid byte 2 of 4-byte UTF-8 sequence. 

$ xmllint /home/pra/tmp/SearchRequest.xml 
/home/pra/tmp/SearchRequest.xml:672: parser error : Input is not proper UTF-8, indicate encoding ! 
Bytes: 0xF6 0x6E 0x3C 0x2F 
    <author>Ola Sch�n</author>
fields.summary: The RSS feed Jira provides does not encode the XML file correctly when Swedish characters are used in data

fields.description:
If a project has issue-level security scheme assigned, and a user has set-security-level permission, security level is required to create an issue. This makes it impossible to create an issue through SOAP, because RemoteIssue doesn't provide such field.

More specifically:
a) if I try to create an issue as usual, I get an error saying "security level is required".
b) any ways to pass security level to the server fail, including specifying custom field of name "security" or specifying <security> tag in the SOAP request.

Interestingly, I can change security level through SOAP's updateIssue request because it doesn't use RemoteIssue.
fields.summary: Cannot create issue through SOAP remote API if issue-level security is on

Of security reasons and to keep track of who is changing what an audit log (change log) of all configuration changes would be really useful.
fields.summary: Audit log for configuration changes

fields.description:
The screenshot applet's certificate that was used for signing in JIRA 3.8 has expired since July 2007.  This may cause a popup to show up prompting users to accept the expired certificate first before they can use it. When users select the screenshot option, they get a warning that the certificate is not valid - it appears to have expired in July. As long as they click to continue, it works ok but many users are reluctant to do so. 

I've attached an updated screenshot.jar to this issue that has been re-signed with a valid certificate.
fields.summary: Screenshot applet certificate has expired in July 2007

fields.description:
I tried attaching a file with a Jira issue. Incedently the file was empty.

fields.description:
Bugzilla importer allows the user to enter a project key for the Bugzilla project (being imported) with the same name as already existing project in JIRA. As a result no such project is created _(JIRA ensures the uniqness of project names)_ and Bugzilla issues are imported into the existing JIRA project.

This is confusing as the project does not get created and the only message about that is in the import logs, e.g.
{noformat}
Project: TestProduct already exists. Not imported
0 projects imported from Bugzilla.
{noformat}

The steps to reproduce this:
# import TestProduct from the attached Bugzilla MySQL dump, give it project key *TESTA*
# notice that project *TESTA* (key) - *TestProduct* (name) was created and it has one issue TESTA-1
# use the same import steps, but this time around give it the project key *TESTB*
# notice that project *TESTB* was NOT created and issue was imported into TESTA as *TESTA-2*

*The fix for this would be to recognize that issues for a project will be imported to the existing JIRA project with the same project name and instead of input fields for project key and project lead, only text displaying the existing JIRA project key and lead should presented to the user (read-only).*
fields.summary: Bugzilla importer should not ask for project key and project lead for existing JIRA projects
Jira RSS 2.0 does not work with standard java parser  - pubDate elements are incorrect

fields.description:
The velocity template used when producing the XML view of an issue filter, WEB-INF/classes/templates/plugins/issueviews/single-xml.vm, has an $rssMode variable, which when set to 'raw' should produce the description (and some other fields) unescaped in a CDATA string.

It has two problems.

1. There is no way to pass through the rssMode = 'raw' via the URL (there used to be), and hence this mode is not very useful.

2. If you hack the file to set $rssMode to 'raw', the template breaks whenever the escCdata macro is used with a parameter that is null. For example, this can easily be the case with the environment field. And it breaks in a not so obvious manner.

Attached is a modified [^single-xml.vm] that fixes the second problem. It might not be the most elegant solution though.
fields.summary: Problems with 'raw' rssMode when producing XML view of issue filter (in single-xml.vm)

fields.description:
JIRA's time tracking capabilities are heavily tied to the user-contributed 'Kaamelot' at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/Kaamelot but this plugin is unclear on it's features. It would be useful to document specific new features, reports this plugin can generate and attach screenshots.

Until this can be documented, customer enquiries on reporting time tracking must be based on informal experience with the plugins, which often results in a 'this is not supported, but please check out these plugins' reply. If the authors are unavailable to assist with documentation, it may be worthwhile to devote Atlassian resources to improving them.
fields.summary: Document features and screenshots for 'Kaamelot' plugin

fields.description:
I would like to bind the account of a certain user to a given IP address, i.e. only if the user logs in from the given IP, the login is successful.

We are using Jira and Confluence and make heavy use of the "jiraissues" macro in confluence. However we need to provide a username and an password in the URL to get this feature properly working. Hence it would be nice if we could create a "jiraissues" user that everyone could use in the URL. However we would need to restrict access to this user by e.g. only allowing requests from this particular user to be coming from the localhost (the same host that Jira/Confluence are running on).

It is a basic security feature for anyone using Jira/Confluence together and especially for anyone making use of some of the given macros.
fields.summary: Documentation regarding restricting access to JIRA basing on username and IP address.

fields.description:
| Everyone should be able to use http-links referring to private filters! |

*Situation*
Imagine you are a normal Jira user, without special permissions (i.e. "JIRA Administrators" or "Create shared filter"). You have created a wonderful filter with exactly the right columns in the perfect order - and now you want to share it with some of your colleges. 

But it is impossible :-(  

If you send them a link to your filter, they will get this message:
"You do not have the permission to view the selected private filter"

And if you give them a Permlink to your filter, they won't see what you see. 

It is even worse, if you have used your private filter to create a report - there is no way you can share this report with others.

*"Semi-workarounds"*
You could send a perm-link to the filter
 - But it is an extra step 
 - And more importantly - you will lose you column layout

Or you could ask your filter-administrator to create a shared filter
 - But you have to involve others and it is extra work
 - And you may not have a suitable JIRA-group in your setup, to share the filter to
   (Unless it is a truly brilliant filter, which your administrator will share globally)

*Solution*
| Everyone should be able to use http-links referring to private filters! |

* This way it would be easy to share filters and reports with simple links.

This would also reduce some of the other problems with filters:
* You don't need to create extra groups, just for sharing a filter
    (in our organisation we use project-roles in stead of JIRA-groups)
* You are no longer limited to share filters to ONE group of users (JRA-4139) 
* It would reduce the need for shared filters - which again would ease the administration of filters

*Possible problems*
I can't see any. No matter how the filtering is done (filter or Permlink), the user will only see the issues he is allowed to see.

Of course the link would stop working, if the private filter is deleted - but that is the way of links (and also true for shared filters).

If the filter is changed after the link has been sent, it may confuse the user of the link (again, that is also true for shared filters). It is probably a bigger problem with private filters, so perhaps there should be a note in the filter-information box, that the current filter is private.

If it turns out, that there is a problem with allowing everyone to see all private filters, you could add a new option to "Global permissions":
"Allow use of all private filters for group(s): <Jira-group>"

*Example*
Here is a great ;-) filter I have created:
http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?requestId=15160&mode=hide 

And here is the Permlink - but without my column layout:
http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&&query=enterprise&summary=true&description=true&environment=true&type=4&type=2&pid=10240&resolution=-1&sorter/field=priority&sorter/order=DESC&sorter/field=updated&sorter/order=DESC 
 
And if you want to see my report - you have to do the following:
# save the Permlink as your own filter
# go to any project and chose "Single level group by report"
# use your new filter
# and group by component

...or you could look at the attached screen dump.

It would be so much easier, if you could just use this link:
http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ConfigureReport.jspa?filterid=15160&mapper=components&selectedProjectId=10240&reportKey=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.reports%3Asinglelevelgroupby&Next=Next
fields.summary: Allow access to private filters for everybody

fields.description:
JIRA custom fields can have their default values and possible options differ for each project/issue type. The JIRA user interface seems confused about the terminology of these things. Here is a screenshot of the custom field page, with two of these things configured:

!cf_configschemes.png!

The problem lies with the "Edit configuration" link. *It should be renamed to "Edit context"*, since:
 - The label on the left says "Applicable _contexts_ for scheme".
 - The page you get to after clicking is titled "Modify configuration scheme _context_, and is indeed all about setting the context.
 - You can't edit the custom field options on this page, which are certainly _part_ of the context.

So _really_ you're editing a context, not a configuration.
fields.summary: UI bug: confusing between custom field "configurations" and "contexts".

fields.description:
When we do a search that includes a comment paramater, we do a search on the comment index, generate a list of keys and then pass that in to the normal search.  When we do the search on the comment index we should use a FieldableDocumentHitCollector that only sucks in the issue id, this should improve things as we wont need to pull the body of the comment into the document.

Though, it may not be that simple as we don;t actually use a HitCollector for this.  We get the hits and iterate over them manually - might want to use a hit collector....

See - LuceneQueryCreator.getCommentsFilter(Hits hits)
fields.summary: Comment queries should use FieldableDocumentHitCollector

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13329].
  {panel}

Create a group with a name longer than 60 characters. Then try to add it to a notification scheme. You get the following error (on the screen as well as in the logs):
{noformat}
org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO notification (ID, SCHEME, 
EVENT, EVENT_TYPE_ID, TEMPLATE_ID, notif_type, notif_parameter) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Data truncation: Data too long for 
column 'notif_parameter' at row 1)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.executeUpdate(SQLProcessor.java:375)
{noformat}

The problem is that the notif_parameter column of the notification table is a varchar(60), and the groupname is stored directly in this field. 
The groupname field of the groupbase table is varchar(255).

This bug is compounded by the fact that you can't simply change a group name (to reduce it to less than 60 characters).

A support customer has this issue in 3.6.5 Enterprise running on Postgres. I have reproduced it in 3.10.1 Enterprise running MySQL.
fields.summary: Error when adding a group with name longer than 60 characters to a notification scheme: too long for database column

fields.description: We need the ability to differentiate between users that can see an issue's comments and users that can (also) see an issue's worklog.  There already is a separate permission for "View Version Control ".  What we need is a "View Worklog" permission that behaves similarly.
fields.summary: Add "View Worklog" Permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13327].
  {panel}

Our workplace uses Jira with comments sorted in descending order by default.

I often reference and check back to the more recently made comments when commenting on an issue. When comments are sorted in descending order the new comment textarea is displayed at the bottom of the page, furthest from the most recent comments. This causes lots of scrolling back and forth between the recent comments and the textarea where I am filling in my comment (which is exacerbated for issues that have a large number of comments).

At the moment I have written [a custom Greasemonkey script|http://userscripts.org/scripts/show/9003] which moves the location of the new comment textarea to appear above the comment list in order to reduce me needing to scroll back and forth.

It would be fantastic if this change could be incorporated into Jira when comments are sorted in descending order.
fields.summary: Change location of new comment textarea when comments are sorted in descending order

fields.description:
Hi Rosie,

We have had a few cases where support customers are getting confused as to whether they should upgrade using the proper way (XML export and import) or by the "quick" way - pointing the new instance at the existing database. In particular, some customers seem confused about when they need to do the intermediate step via 3.7 (only needed for the "quick" way, but some customers think they need to do this for proper way as well).

I think it might need a technical writer's eagle eye over [Upgrading JIRA Safely|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/upgrading.html] and [SQL Scripts for 3.6.x to 3.7 schema upgrade|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/SQL+Scripts+for+3.6.x+to+3.7+schema+upgrade], to make sure that this documentation is as crystal clear as it can be.

While you are there, Jeff has written a page on [Making databases read-only for upgrade backups|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Making+databases+read-only+for+upgrade+backups]. Could you please add a link to it from the main doco, although some of the initial description in that page - the first four or five sentences about the issues around ensuring a consistent backup by making sure no one is changing the database - should probably go in the main page.

Let me know if you need any help or further info. Thanks.
fields.summary: Refine "Upgrading JIRA Safely" page

But the result of a call to the service 'getCustomFields' (retrieving all Custom fields) should contain more info than just the id and the name.
Especially with CustomField which type is Cascading Select and has Custom Field Options it is important to have at least the Custom Field options, because such a Custom Field filled in an issue will return ID's as its CustomFieldValues and I cannot relate these ID's to the selected options.

So adding String type and String[ ][ ] options to the bean and String get/setType and String[ ][ ] get/setOptions methods should be done.

fields.description:
A support customer has reported the following problem. An issue contains non-Ascii characters in the summary and description. When this issue is in the results of a issue filter, and you do an XML view of the issue filter, the characters are "doubly-escaped" in the description, but not in the summary.

So if the issue contains "ä ö ü" in the summary and description, here is the resulting XML (excerpt):

{noformat}
<title>[TST-25] Non-ascii characters in summary and description: ä ö ü</title>
<link>http://localhost:8090/jira/browse/TST-25</link>
<description>And in the description as well: &#xE4; &#xF6; &#xFC;</description>
<environment></environment>
<key id="10080">TST-25</key>
<summary>Non-ascii characters in summary and description: ä ö ü</summary>
{noformat}

Note that the XML appears fine in Firefox and IE when they interpret the output an an RSS feed. When you do a View Source though or save the XML to a file, you get the above.

I was able to readily reproduce the problem on JIRA Standalone 3.10.1 on my box. Then things got complicated...

I created a test issue on http://jira.atlassian.com to include in my (what I thought was going to be straightforward) bug report. Here is it: TST-11826. However I cannot reproduce the bug there. Here is the XML output from a search filter containing that issue:

{noformat}
title>[TST-11827] Another attempt: ä ö ü</title>
<link>http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TST-11827</link>
<description>And in the description as well: ä ö ü</description>
<environment></environment>
<key id="56080">TST-11827</key>
<summary>Another attempt: ä ö ü</summary>
{noformat}

So I thought about what was different between http://jira.atlassian.com and my box. http://jira.atlassian.com uses:
- Apache proxy server
- Resin
- PostgreSQL

I went and tested all these options. I tried in an JIRA Standalone instance using PostgreSQL. It produced the bug. I tried in an instance running Resin (same version as http://jira.atlassian.com) and Postgres. It produced the bug. I tried on an instance with Apache in front of it. It produced the bug.

Jeff and I played with port forwarding to view the output of http://jira.atlassian.com without going through the Apache proxy. It didn't produce the bug. (That is, the Apache proxy is not a factor.)

I also tried in https://support.atlassian.com. It did not produce the bug.

So in any case, it is a bug, and one that is readily reproducible, as long as you don't use http://jira.atlassian.com or https://support.atlassian.com. ????

Let me know if you have any ideas for further tests to try and isolate it, and I am happy to try them out.
fields.summary: Non-ascii characters in description of issue are double-escaped in XML view of issue filter containing that issue

fields.description:
In order to safely upgrade an JIRA instance, we need to be able to stop users using the JIRA instance during the backup and restore. One way to do most of this is to restart JIRA on a different port before doing the export then restore. That way users can't access it. However this does not stop services running and doing stuff.

Hence this issue. It would be a good idea to make sure that services do not run during a manual XML export or restore.

(Note that we are also recommending another way of stopping users changing the database: modiffying the database connection settings to make the database read-only during the export. This doesn't need services to be disabled during the export. But it is a good idea anyway.)
fields.summary: Disable services during manual backup to XML file, and during manual restore from XML

fields.description:
Currently the documentation says
{quote}
<provider class="com.opensymphony.user.provider.ldap.LDAPCredentialsProvider">
  <property name="java.naming.factory.initial">com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtxFactory</property>
  <property name="java.naming.provider.url">ldap://localhost:389</property>
  <property name="searchBase">ou=People,dc=atlassian,dc=com</property>
  *<property name="uidSearchName">uid</property>*
  <property name="java.naming.security.principal">cn=admin,dc=atlassian,dc=com</property>
  <property name="java.naming.security.credentials">secret</property>
  <property name="exclusive-access">true</property>
</provider>

If you have problems, try emulating the operations performed by the LDAP authentication provider. The LDAP authentication provider works by first doing an search for the specified username, searching from base searchBase, {color:red}using query uidSearchName=username{color}, authenticating using the principal and credentials properties if present, or doing an anonymous search otherwise. If an entry is found, it then tries to log in to LDAP using the specified matching username and specified password. 
{quote}

The phrase marked in red is most likely wrong; the LDAP search is for (uid=username) rather than (uidSearchName=username). This reflects standard schema usage as well (RFC2377). Further indication that this is wrong is the log segment shown above.
fields.summary: Error in http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.4.3/ldap.html

fields.description:
For more information, see http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/HDS/%27JIRA+Manager%27+Permission
* For DevSuite, we will need a permission level similar to Global Administrator except with some permissions removed.
* Permissions to be removed are those which could jeopardize the file system or hosted environment.
* For the install product, a typical use case is where a top-level administrator wants to delegate some administration privileges to a manager, team leader, etc., but not those which could jeopardize the application environment, network, etc.
* We would like to add a permission level, hierarchically between 'JIRA Administrator' and 'JIRA User' which we refer to as 'JIRA Manager'
* We would like this permission to have access to the same Administration functions as 'JIRA Administrator', except with the following changes to the JIRA Administration menu:
 
* Global Settings
** Attachments:  remove 'directory' setting
** CVS Modules:  remove entirely
** Global Permissions:  remove entirely
** Mail Servers:  remove entirely
** Trackbacks:  remove entirely
** Workflows:  remove 'import' feature
* Import & Export:  remove entire section
* Options & Settings
** Jelly Runner:  remove entirely
* System
** Indexing:  remove entirely
** Integrity Checker:  remove entirely
** LDAP:  remove entirely
** License Details:  remove entirely
** Listeners:  remove entirely
** Logging & Profiling:  remove entirely
** Plugins:  remove entirely
** Scheduler Details:  remove entirely
** Services:  remove entirely
** System: only keep 
*** Mail Queue 
*** System Info 
*** Support Request


References
* http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-3156
* http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-1431
* http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-4176
* http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-11562
fields.summary: 'JIRA System Administrator' Permission

Some users are interested in generating a visual representation of their custom workflow. Two tools that can be used are:
1. Graphviz from http://www.graphviz.org/ 
2. OSWorkflow GUI Designer from http://www.opensymphony.com/osworkflow/ and documented at http://www.opensymphony.com/osworkflow/4.%20GUI%20Designer.html is an alternative but it may not format the representation as well as Graphviz

Edit: While JIRA can import workflows from XML, the documentation should also warn users only to use the tools for viewing since editing workflows outside of JIRA is problematic - see [Anton's comment|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-13268#action_85610] below for details.

|John Smith|19/Jul/07 19:43| 27m|17|

|John Smith|22/Jul/07 17:57| 7h 12m|37|
